meanings.definition: A person who supervises students during an examination.
meanings.sent1: During the test, the proctor made sure no one cheated.
meanings.sent2: The school hired a proctor to oversee the exam.
meanings.sent3: The proctor caught a student trying to sneak a peek at their notes.
meanings.sent4: The diligent proctor's eagle eyes scanned the room for any signs of dishonesty.
meanings.sent5: The proctor's watchful gaze kept the students in line.

meanings.sent1: I will proctor the exam tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She proctored the test with fairness and integrity.
meanings.sent3: He decided to proctor the quiz wearing a funny hat.
meanings.sent4: The teacher proctored the final exam with a calm demeanor.

meanings.definition: A person who manages the affairs of another.
meanings.sent1: The proctor handled all the paperwork for the client.
meanings.sent2: She was appointed as the proctor of the estate.
meanings.sent3: The proctor organized the schedule for the busy executive.
meanings.sent4: As the proctor, he oversaw the financial matters of the company.
meanings.sent5: The proctor ensured that everything ran smoothly for the business owner.
